peopleAlsoAsk.question: How do you get coins appraised without getting ripped off?
peopleAlsoAsk.snippet:
COMMENTS SECTION
Choose an Independent Appraiser: Avoid dealers who also buy coins--they have an incentive to undervalue.
Keep Coins Organized: Leave them in their original holders and group them by type, denomination, and era if possible.
Document Everything:
Request a Written Report:
Be Present During the Appraisal:

peopleAlsoAsk.question: How do I find a trustworthy coin appraiser?
peopleAlsoAsk.snippet: You want to find a coin collector or coin appraiser who is ethical and won't rip you off. BBB can help you find highly rated and BBB Accredited coin shops near you. To see only BBB Accredited coin dealers, use the filter.
peopleAlsoAsk.title: Coin Dealers Near Me | Better Business Bureau

peopleAlsoAsk.question: Is there a free app to scan coins for value?
peopleAlsoAsk.snippet: Coinoscope is a free app available for Android and iOS that helps users identify coins and check their value. The app utilizes advanced image recognition technology for accurate coin identification. Coinoscope provides insights into market value, rarity, and other essential details for coin collectors.
peopleAlsoAsk.title: The Free App to Identify Coins and Check Coin Value

peopleAlsoAsk.question: How do you know if a coin appraiser is legit?
peopleAlsoAsk.snippet: Research Appraisers: Look for reputable coin appraisers or numismatists. You can find them through: - Professional organizations like the American Numismatic Association (ANA). - Local coin shops or dealers with good reviews. - Online directories of certified appraisers.
